newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai soybeans end mixed on uncertainties.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai soybeans end mixed on uncertainties.

text.p: Shanghai soybean futures ended mixed on Thursday with investors unsure of what direction the market will take, traders said.
The most actively traded May 1997 contract ended at 3,394 yuan ($409) per tonne, rising 102 yuan. It opened at an intraday low of 3,300 yuan and hit a high of 3,395 yuan.
July fell 28 yuan to 3,290, September rose to 59 to 3,344, November fell one to 3,378, the January 1998 contract gained 14 to 3,394 and March dropped four to 3,390 yuan.
Combined volume rose to 23,400 tonnes from 21,000 tonnes.
Most soybean contracts moved around opening levels for the best part of the session, traders said.
"Many investors remained on the sidelines due to a lack of market-moving news," one trader said.
"Active trading on the stock markets has been drawing a lot of hot money away from the futures market lately," he said.
Traders said they expected soybeans to remain sluggish in the short term.
